snippet: Agnieszka Holland discusses her choice to make a third Holocaust-related film, "In Darkness," which is up for an Oscar.
abstract: Agnieszka Holland discusses her choice to make a third Holocaust-related film, "In Darkness," which is up for an Oscar.
lead_paragraph: The Polish director Agnieszka Holland doesn't consider herself a specialist in Holocaust themes, but all three of her Oscar nominations are for films about that subject. The most recent, "In Darkness," is one of five contenders for this year's Academy Award for best foreign-language film, with a cast that is largely Polish and German and, though based on a script originally written in English, dialogue in Polish, German, Yiddish and Ukrainian.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
